result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Gabriel Perez Vega

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 10/27/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KMM. 
- Defendant shall not be on Waxwing Ln. 
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur. The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)].

Defendant Michael G Perez Vega in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez in court for Michael G Perez Vega.  Attorney Benjamin Wagner in court for State of Wisconsin. 
DEFENDANT WENT INTO CUSTODY
Parties stipulate to return cash bail posted to the bond poster and impose cash $125 per case with previously ordered conditions remaining
Bail/bond hearing on October 27, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Michael G Perez Vega in court.  Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez in court for Michael G Perez Vega.  Attorney Daniel Hess in court for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter, Jim Larson, appeared in person. Bond Poster/Victim K.M.M. appeared via telephone.  

Court verifies that K.M.M. still wishes to request bond money be returned to her. State gives no position; Atty Gonzalez gives argument against return of bond but alternately requests signature bond if bond money returned.

Court is not Victims Rights Compliant on cases other than 22CM808. 
State gives objection to signature bond on case 22CM808; Atty Gonzalez gives argument to leave all cases as is with no change to bond conditions or return of bond money to bond poster.

Court tables bail/bond hearing; hearing will be set-over to allow for State to become Victim Rights Compliant. K.M.M. may appear by telephone.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
from bond poster to Judge Hyland

ADDRESS INFO for Michael Gabriel Perez Vega
Current: 562 Waxwing Ln, Madison, WI 53704 United States  (Effective: 04-26-2022)

01:50 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. Maribel Marin duly sworn & interpreted. All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
